member.summary: Constructor, allows the key and initialization vetor to be provided

member.summary: Decrypt bytes
member.returns: Decrypted data as bytes

member.summary: Encrypt bytes
member.returns: Encrypted data as bytes

member.summary: Decrypt a string
member.returns: Decrypted data as string

member.summary: Encrypt a string
member.returns: Encrypted data as string

member.name: M:DbNetLink.Encryption.Transform(System.Byte[],System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform)
member.summary: Encrypt or Decrypt bytes.
member.remarks: This is used by the public methods
member.param: Data to be encrypted/decrypted
member.returns: Byte data containing result of opperation

member.name: P:DbNetLink.Encryption.Key
member.summary: Key to use during encryption and decryption

member.name: P:DbNetLink.Encryption.iV
member.summary: Initialization vetor to use during encryption and decryption

member.name: T:DbNetLink.CopyOptions
member.summary: The CopyOptions enum is assigned to the CopyOption property. The CopyOption dictates the way data is move from the source to the target database.
member.remarks: For the MergeRows, InsertRows and UpdateRows options the target and source tables must have a primary key specified as this key is used to uniquely identify a row.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.CopyOptions.SchemaAndData
member.summary: The table is created in the target database and all rows are copied. If the target table exists already it is dropped.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.CopyOptions.SchemaOnly
member.summary: The table is created in the target database but no data is copied. If the target table exists already it is dropped.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.CopyOptions.ReplaceRows
member.summary: It is assumed that the table already exists in the target database. All rows are delete from the target table and replaced woth the rows in the source table

member.name: F:DbNetLink.CopyOptions.MergeRows
member.summary: It is assumed that the table already exists in the target database. Any rows where the primary key value cannot be found in the target database are added. Any rows where the primary key value can be found in the target database are updated. This is effectively the same as running InsertRows and UpdateRows together.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.CopyOptions.InsertRows
member.summary: It is assumed that the table already exists in the target database. Any rows where the primary key value cannot be found in the target database are added.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.CopyOptions.UpdateRows
member.summary: It is assumed that the table already exists in the target database. Any rows where the primary key value can be found in the target database are updated.

member.name: T:DbNetLink.SchemaOptions
member.summary: The SchemaOptions enum is assigned to the SchemaOption property. The SchemaOption dictates the way schema information is transferred to the target database.
member.remarks: Some databases such MS Access do not support schemas and for these databases the Preserve option will not work

member.name: F:DbNetLink.SchemaOptions.Drop
member.summary: Does not use the source schema name to qualify the table in the target database.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.SchemaOptions.Preserve
member.summary: Attempts to qualify the target table name with the source schema name.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.SchemaOptions.IncludeInTableName
member.summary: Prefixes the target table name with the schema name in order to ensure the table name is unique

member.name: T:DbNetLink.TransactionModes
member.summary: The TransactionModes enum is assigned to the TransactionMode property. The TransactionMode controls the way database transactions are used to preserve the integrity of the copying of a table to the target database.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.TransactionModes.None
member.summary: Transactions are not used when copying a table from the source to the target database

member.name: F:DbNetLink.TransactionModes.Table
member.summary: The copyiing of each table is done inside a transaction such that if an error occurs the state of the database is rolled back to the point at which the copying of the table began.

member.name: T:DbNetLink.UpdateActions
member.summary: The UpdateActions enum is used to indicate the type of update that is to be applied.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.UpdateActions.Insert
member.summary: Row is to be inserted

member.name: F:DbNetLink.UpdateActions.Update
member.summary: Row is to be updated

member.name: T:DbNetLink.CopyModes
member.summary: The CopyModes enum is used to indicate the mode in which the data is copied.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.CopyModes.SingleRecord
member.summary: The data is copied one row at a time. This is the most flexible method and suppored by all database types

member.name: F:DbNetLink.CopyModes.Batch
member.summary: The data is sent to the database server in batches. More efficient that SingleRecord especially on slower network connections.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.CopyModes.Bulk
member.summary: The fastest method of moving data from one server to another. Currently only supported by SqlClient and DB2 providers.
member.remarks: Bulk mode can only be used with the SchemaAndData and ReplaceRows CopyOptions With Bulk mode the OnBeforeRowCopied, OnBeforeColumnCopied and OnBeforeRowApplied events must not have handlers assigned to them as they are bypassed.

member.name: T:DbNetLink.BeforeRowCopiedEventArgs
member.summary: Argument for the OnBeforeRowCopied event

member.name: F:DbNetLink.BeforeRowCopiedEventArgs.UpdateParams
member.summary: The update parameters that will update the row in the target table

member.name: F:DbNetLink.BeforeRowCopiedEventArgs.SourceDataReader
member.summary: The DataReader holding the current source table row

member.name: F:DbNetLink.BeforeRowCopiedEventArgs.TargetTableName
member.summary: The name of the target table to be updated

member.name: F:DbNetLink.BeforeRowCopiedEventArgs.UpdateAction
member.summary: Indicates if the target table row is to be inserted or updated

member.summary: BeforeRowCopiedEventArgs constructor
member.param: The update parameters that will update the row in the target table
The DataReader holding the current source table row
The name of the target table to be updated
Indicates if the target table row is to be inserted or updated

member.summary: The value of the column to be copied

member.summary: The name of the target table to be updated

member.summary: The name of the target table to be updated

member.summary: The DataReader holding the current source table row

member.summary: The pre-assigned IDbCommand object

member.summary: The name of the target table to be updated

member.summary: BeforeRowAppliedEventArgs constructor

The value of the column to be copied

member.summary: The DataTable populated with schema creation information

member.name: T:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy
member.summary: The DbNetCopy class is used to copy data from one database to another. The source and target database can be any of the supported databases (

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.CopyMode
member.summary: The CopyMode property controls the mechanism in which data is copied from the source to the target database and is assigned a value from the CopyModes enum.
member.remarks: The default value is

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.CopyOption
member.summary: The CopyOption property controls the way in which data is copied from the source to the target database and is assigned a value from the CopyOptions enum.
member.remarks: The default value is

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.SchemaOption
member.summary: The SchemaOption property controls the way in which schema information is tranbsferred from the source to the target database value from the SchemaOptions enum.
member.remarks: The default value is

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.CopyIndexes
member.summary: Controls the copying of index and primary key information.
member.remarks: The default value is True

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.DropTargetTable
member.summary: Controls the dropping of tables in the target database if they already exist.
member.remarks: An attempt to create a table in the target database that already exists will generate an exception unless DropTargetTable is set to True. The default value is False.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.Cancelled
member.summary: Set this property to true to cause a controlled immediate ending to the copy process

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.LicenseKey
member.summary: As an alternative to picking up the license key from the configuration file you can assign the LicenseKey property explicitly in your code

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.TransactionMode
member.summary: The TransactionMode property dictates the use or otherwise of transactions when copying a table and is assined a value from the TransactionModes enum.
member.remarks: The default value is

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.SourceEncoding
member.summary: The SourceEncoding property is used to specify the encoding of the source database when converting the encoding as a part of the copy process

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.TargetEncoding
member.summary: The TargetEncoding property is used to specify the encoding of the target database when converting the encoding as a part of the copy process

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.UpdateBatchSize
member.summary: Specifies the number of records sent for update in a single round-trip to the database.
member.remarks: Has no effect unless the Batch CopyMode is specified

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.#ctor(DbNetLink.DbNetData,DbNetLink.DbNetData)
member.summary: DbNetCopy constructor
member.param: Source DbNetData instance
Target DbNetData instance

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.CopyDatabase
member.summary: Copies all the tables in the source database to the target database

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.CopyDatabase(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copies all the tables in the source database from the specified schema to the target database schema
member.param: The name of the source table schema
The name of the target table schema

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.CopyTable(System.String)
member.summary: Copies the specified table to the target database
member.param: The name of the table to copy

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.CopyTable(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copies the specified table to the target database renaming the table with the specified TargetTableName
member.param: The name of the table in the source database
The name of the table in the target database

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.CopyTable(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Copies only the specified columns of the source table to the target database
member.param: The name of the table in the source database
The name of the table in the target database
A list of column names to copy

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.CopyTable(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Copies only the specified columns of the source table to the target database using the supplied column name(s) as the keys values used to determine if the record exists in the target database. The KeyColumns parameter can be used where a primary key is not automatically identifiable such as in an Excel spreadheet.
member.param: The name of the table in the source database
The name of the table in the target database
A list of column names to copy
A list of primary key column name(s)

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.EmptyTargetDatabase(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Drops the supplied list of tables from the target database
member.param: A list of tables names to drop

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.EmptyTargetDatabase
member.summary: Drops all tables from the target database

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.EmptyTargetDatabase(System.String)
member.summary: Drops all tables from the specified schema in the target database
member.param: The name of the target database schema from which tables should be dropped

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.EmptyTargetDatabase(System.String,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Drops the supplied list of tables from the specified schema in the target database
member.param: A list of tables names to drop
The name of the target database schema from which tables should be dropped

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.SummaryDataTable
member.summary: Returns a DataTable containing summary information for each of the copied tables

remarks.para: The DataTable contains a row for each table that was copied and the each row contains the following columns

item.para: The name of the source table
The name of the target table

member.returns: DataTable

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.UpdateParameterPlaceholder(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Can be used in the OnBeforeRowApplied event handler to modify the CommandText paramater placeholder for a particular column
member.remarks: See OnBeforeRowApplied for an example of implementation

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.UpdateTargetTableColumn(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Can be used in the OnBeforeTableCreated event handler to modify a column definition before the target table is created.
member.remarks: See OnBeforeTableCreated for an example of implementation

member.name: E:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.OnBeforeRowCopied
member.summary: The OnBeforeRowCopied event allows the values in the source row to be reviewed and modified if necessary before being assigned to the update/insert command. The applying of the update on the target table can be suppressed by returning false from the event handler.
member.remarks: The handler is passed a reference to the DbNetCopy object and the BeforeRowCopiedEventArgs object

member.name: E:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.OnBeforeTableCreated
member.summary: The OnBeforeTableCreated event allows the definition of the target table schema to be modified before it is created in the target database
member.remarks: The handler is passed a reference to the DbNetCopy object and theBeforeTableCreatedEventArgs object The method UpdateTargetTableColumn can be used to update the schema text for the specfied column.

member.name: E:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.OnBeforeRowApplied
member.summary: The OnBeforeRowApplied event allows command parameters and command text to be reviewed and/or modified just prior to the target row being inserted/updated
member.remarks: The handler is passed a reference to the DbNetCopy object and the BeforeRowAppliedEventArgs object The method UpdateParameterPlaceholder can be used to update the parameter placeholder in the command text. For example you may want to use a database function to process the value as it is applied to the database

member.name: E:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.OnBeforeColumnCopied
member.summary: The OnBeforeColumnCopied event is invoked before the source column value is assigned to the row update parameter collection and offers an opportunity to modify the value
member.remarks: The handler is passed a reference to the DbNetCopy object and the BeforeColumnCopiedEventArgs object

member.name: E:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.OnSourceRowRead
member.summary: The OnSourceRowRead event is invoked as each row is read from the target database
member.remarks: The handler is passed a reference to the DbNetCopy object and the SourceRowReadEventArgs object

member.name: P:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.RecordLimit
member.summary: Limits the number of rows read for copying
member.remarks: On a large table you may wish to limit the number of number of rows copied intially in a testing phase

member.name: P:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.SourceConnection
member.summary: The Source Database DbNetData instance and is assigned in the DbNetCopy constructor.

member.name: P:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.TargetConnection
member.summary: The Target Database DbNetData instance and is assigned in the DbNetCopy constructor.

member.name: P:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.CurrentSourceTableName
member.summary: The CurrentSourceTableName property identifies the name of the source table that is currently being copied

member.name: P:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.CurrentTargetTableName
member.summary: The CurrentTargetTableName property identifies the name of the target table that is currently being copied

member.name: P:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.CurrentColumnOrdinal
member.summary: The CurrentColumnOrdinal property identifies the ordinal of the column that is currently being copied. Used specifcally in the OnBeforeColumnCopied event

member.name: T:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.BeforeRowCopiedHandler
member.summary: Delegate definition for the event.

member.name: T:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.BeforeTableCreatedHandler
member.summary: Delegate definition for the event.

member.name: T:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.BeforeRowAppliedHandler
member.summary: Delegate definition for the event.

member.name: T:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.SourceRowReadHandler
member.summary: Delegate definition for the event.

member.name: T:DbNetLink.DbNetCopy.BeforeColumnCopiedHandler
member.summary: Delegate definition for the event.

member.name: T:DbNetLink.DbNetData
member.summary: The DbNetData class is used to encapsulate a database connection with a collection of methods and properties that use the connection.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.Adapter
member.summary: IDbDataAdapter implemented by provider

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.Conn
member.summary: IDbConnection implemented by provider

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.Command
member.summary: IDbCommand implemented by provider

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.Reader
member.summary: IDataReader implemented by provider

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.Transaction
member.summary: IDbTransaction implemented by provider

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.CloseConnectionOnError
member.summary: If set to true then the connection is automatically closed if an error occurs

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.InjectionDetectionEnabled
member.summary: If set to true then the command text will have any illegal characters rejected

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.CommandTimeout
member.summary: The number of seconds before a command will timeout. 30 is the default. A value of 0 will prevent a timeout.

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.Identity
member.summary: The autoincrementing value assigned to the last inserted record (where applicable). Only set if is set to true

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.CommandDurationWarningThreshold
member.summary: The threshold in milliseconds above which details of commands executing for longer will be logged

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.NameDelimiterTemplate
member.summary: The template used to qualify database object names containing spaces

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.ReturnAutoIncrementValue
member.summary: Determines if an attempt is made to fetch the value assigned by an autoincrementing column after an insert

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.RowsAffected
member.summary: The number of rows affected by the last or method

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.DataSourcePath
member.summary: The fully mapped path to the data source

member.summary: Controls the verbosity of the error message

member.summary: Prevents accidental execution of unqualified update/delete statements

member.summary: Controls the level of detail shown in any exceptions

member.summary: Converts empty string to null values in update statements when set to true

member.summary: Controls the display of the connection string when reporting an error condition

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.QualifyAllObjectNames

member.name: F:DbNetLink.DbNetData.UpgradeSQLServerCE
member.summary: If true will automatically upgrade a SQL Server CE database.

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of DbNeData by deriving the connection string from the configuration file using the name DbNetData

remarks.para: The connection string is derived on the following basis:

list.item: IAn entry in the web.config connection strings collection called DbNetData is looked for

example.code: DbNetData Db = new DbNetData();

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of DbNeData without provider information
member.remarks:
The provider is derived on the following basis:
If the connection string matches the regular expression "Provider=.*oledb.*;" then the OleDb data provider is used
If the connection string matches the regular expression "dsn=.*" then the Odbc data provider is used
If the connection string matches the regular expression "Data Source=(.*)\.vdb3;" then the VistaDB data provider is used
If the connection string matches the regular expression "Data Source=(.*)\.fdb;" then the Firebird data provider is used
If the connection string matches none of the above then the SqlClient data provider is used
Provider information can also be supplied in the connection string as an additional property called DataProvider specifying one of the supported Data providers
member.param: Connection string

example.code: DbNetData Db = new DbNetData("Server=dbserver;Database=Northwind;Trusted_Connection=true;");
DbNetData Db = new DbNetData("Provider=Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0;Data Source=C:\data\hr.mdb");
// Speciying the data provider in the connection string DbNetData Db = new DbNetData("Data Source=Employees;user id=scott;password=tiger;DataProvider=OracleClient;");
// You can also simply provide the key for a <connectionStrings> entry in the web.config entry DbNetData Db = new DbNetData("nwind");

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.#ctor(System.String,DbNetLink.DataProvider)
member.summary: Creates an instance of DbNeData with the data provider specified
member.param: Connection string

example.code: DbNetData Db = new DbNetData("Data Source=HUMANRESOURCES;user id=hr;password=hr;", DataProvider.OracleClient);

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.#ctor(System.Configuration.ConnectionStringSettings)
member.summary: Creates an instance of DbNeData with an instance of ConnectionStringSettings from the web.config file
member.param: ConnectionStringSettings instance

example.code: ConnectionStringSettings CSS = ConfigurationManager.ConnectionStrings["northwind"]; DbNetData Db = new DbNetData(CSS);

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.#ctor(System.String,DbNetLink.DataProvider,DbNetLink.DatabaseType)
member.summary: Creates an instance of DbNeData with the data provider specified and the database

remarks.para: In most cases specifying the Database type is not necessary as DbNetData can get this information automatically

member.param: Connection string

example.code: DbNetData Db = new DbNetData("DSN=HumanResources;", DataProvider.Odbc, Database.DB2);

member.summary: Opens the database connection

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.ParameterName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns then corresponding database parameter name for the supplied token

param.name: Key
param.para: The unformatted name of the parameter e.g. "userid"

member.returns: The qualified parameter name. For example for an MS SQL Server connection the key "userid" would be returned as "@userid".

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.QualifiedDbObjectName(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Qualifies a delimited list of database object names to ensure that it can can be used in an SQL Statement.
member.remarks: The function only qualifies the name if necessary for example if the name contains an embeded space or is a reserved word.
member.returns: The qualified object names. For example for a MS SQL Server connection the name "order id,product id" would become "[order id],[product id]".

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.QualifiedDbObjectName(System.String)
member.summary: Qualifies a database object name to ensure that it can can be used in an SQL Statement.
member.remarks: The function only qualifies the name if necessary for example if the name contains an embeded space or is a reserved word.

param.name: ObjectName
param.para: The name of the column, table, index etc

member.returns: The qualified object name. For example for a MS SQL Server connection the name "order details" would become "[order details]".

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.UnqualifiedDbObjectName(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the qualifiers from a database object name.

param.name: ObjectName
param.para: The qualified name of the column, table, index etc

member.returns: The unqualified object name. For example for a MS SQL Server connection the name "[order details]" would become "order details".

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.UnqualifiedDbObjectName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the qualifiers from a database object name.

param.name: ObjectName
param.para: The qualified name of the column, table, index etc

param.name: BaseNameOnly
param.para: Only unqualifies the base part of the database object name

member.returns: The unqualified object name. For example for a MS SQL Server connection the name "[northwind].[order details]" would become "[northwind].order details".

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.ReaderString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the string value for the current row in the Reader for the specified column name
member.returns: The reader column value string

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.ReaderValue(System.String)

member.returns: The reader column value

member.name: M:DbNetLink.DbNetData.ReaderValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the value for the current row in the Reader for the specified column index
member.returns: The reader column value
